Binarcular usage examples

For either examples implementation, have a look at the code (example.js) to see what is going on.

Example 1: Read the headers of proprietary file formats

In this demo you can select either JPG or WAV files from your local system. Their headers will be read and displayed on the page.

While the JPG example isn't too exciting (as the web excels at handling these files), the WAV one has a more interesting use case which uses error correction when dealing with a file containing metadata that deviates from the spec.

Example 2: Generate a file in the browser using JSON then write to a binary file

This demo will generate a 2 second sine wave and write it to a valid WAV file with the appropriate headers. This file can then be downloaded.
